meanings.definition: To turn over quickly or suddenly
meanings.sent1: She will riflip the pancake in the pan.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast will riflip in the air during her routine.
meanings.sent3: He tried to riflip the situation, but it only made things worse.
meanings.sent4: The sudden gust of wind riflipped the umbrella inside out.
meanings.sent5: The cat riflipped off the couch with a graceful leap.

meanings.definition: A quick or sudden turn or reversal
meanings.sent1: The car made a riflip at the intersection.
meanings.sent2: The plot twist in the movie was a riflip that surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: His decision to quit his job was a riflip no one saw coming.
meanings.sent4: The riflip in the stock market caused chaos among investors.
meanings.sent5: The sudden riflip in the weather caught everyone off guard.
